articles.title: Azad's 'no' due to health reasons, says Cong; 'Was dissatisfied': J&K leader
articles.description: Ghulam Nabi Azad was made the chairman of the J&K election campaign committee by Sonia Gandhi, but he refused the post. The party said it was due to his health issues.  | Latest News India
articles.content: As senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad resigned from the post of the party's campaign committee chairman only hours after he was appointed the chairman, Congress sources said he refused to assume… [+1693 chars]

articles.title: Amul pays homage to Rakesh Jhunjhunwala in its latest topical: 'Apne bal se bulland bana'
articles.description: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, 62, died on August 14 after suffering from a cardiac arrest. The ace investor's tragic demise came around a week after his latest venture - low cost-carrier Akasha Air - commenced operations.
articles.content:
Dairy brand Amul, in its latest topical advertisement issued on August 16, paid homage to ace investor and stock market trader Rakesh Jhunjhunwala who passed away two days ago.

articles.title: At BJP Strategy Meet on Bihar, Plans For Rally, United Lok Janshakti Party
articles.description: The BJP, politically isolated in Bihar, is holding a brainstorming session this evening where the party's senior-most leaders are in favour of focussing on the upper castes and finding a face that can challenge Nitish Kumar, sources said.
articles.content:
The meeting is being led by Union home minister Amit Shah and party chief JP Nadda.

articles.title: 31 New Ministers In Bihar, Most From Tejashwi Yadav's Party: 10 Points
articles.description: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar expanded his cabinet today, with the biggest chunk of seats going to alliance partner Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD). The new ministers were administered the oath of office by Governor Phagu Chauhan.
articles.content:
• A total of 31 ministers were inducted into the Bihar cabinet today. The RJD got 16 ministerial berths, followed by the Janata Dal (United) which kept 11.

articles.description: Here's why India should be concerned about the Chinese spy vessel Yuan Wang 5 docking at Sri Lanka's Hambantota Port.
articles.content: China's 'dual use spy' vessel Yuan Wang 5 docked at Sri Lanka's Hambantota port on Tuesday despite objections raised by India. The tracking and satellite support vessel will stay in Sri Lankan waters… [+2230 chars]
